oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - James Slater - 2017-09-30
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by singer songwriter James Slater from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on September 30, 2017. Guest appearances by his niece Ariana and Alejandro Sierra. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: James Slater; Alejandro Sierra;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (00:13) Opening comments and songwriter introduction by Abigail St. Pierre / (03:43) Opening comments by James Slater / (03:53) Introduction of next song / (04:05) Performs All I Want From Santa Is A Girl From Atlanta / (05:26) Talks about writing the previous song / (06:28) Performs Mexicoma / (09:25) Introduces and performs Open Season On My Heart / (12:45) Answers question about where song inspiration comes from and plays portion of That's Why God Made Mexico / (14:14) Answers question about who decides which artists will record his song / (15:24) Song introduction and performs Boys In Bands / (19:23) Talks about his background / (20:34) Performs The High Cost Of Living / (23:35) Introduces the next song and performs In My Daughter's Eyes / (26:45) Introduction of his niece Ariana / (27:31) Performs Can't Shake You (duet with Ariana) / (30:37) Talks about Nashville not being just a country music town and introduces co-writer Alejandro Sierra /

(31:15) Introduction of next song and performs So You Don't (Alejandro Sierra with James) / (33:52) Introduces next song and performs Dónde Estás (Alejandro Sierra with James) / (37:30) Answers question about where he writes songs / (38:48) Answers question about how songs are presented to artists / (39:34) Answers question about still practicing piano and performs excerpts of recent pop songs / (41:58) Introduces the next song / (42:20) Performs Heartbreak Superstar (brief excerpt of Bennie And The Jets in the middle) / (46:45) Introduces next song and performs Ain't My Baby Grand / 51:35 Final comments / (51:46) Walk-out music / (01:25:06) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Slater, James; Sierra, Alejandro; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
